shahid-etal-2020-detecting.title: Detecting and understanding moral biases in news
shahid-etal-2020-detecting.author:
Shahid, Usman  and
Di Eugenio, Barbara  and
Rojecki, Andrew  and
Zheleva, Elena
shahid-etal-2020-detecting.paperMotivationText: Even though moral judgment is central to frame analysis, much of the frame analysis research neglects the moral dimension.
shahid-etal-2020-detecting.paperContributionText: The authors annotate news articles for moral frames. They also develop and test a classification model for detecting the presence of moral frames. Lastly, they investigate the relationship between issue frames and moral frames in a small analysis. The paper describes work in progress.
shahid-etal-2020-detecting.paperResultsText: Moral frames have the potential to explain issue-specific frames. Morality frames are used in different proportions and ways amongst Liberals and Conservatives. The annotation of moral frames is challenging for non-expert annotators due to its subjective nature. Agreement on the presence of a moral frame is quite low, while agreement on the type of moral frame is higher.
shahid-etal-2020-detecting.annotIAATypeText: Article MF presence, Sentence MF presence, Article MF type, Sentence MF type
